Description: Two joining fragments of rim and wall North Ionian pottery plate; upturned rounded rim; cream slip; glaze generally fired orange-brown; exterior: rim glazed, sets of three and two bands on wall; interior, from rim: narrow band at rim; hook maeander frieze and wide band with traces of superimposed bands in added red and white; frieze of lotus flowers with small crosses on either side separated by groups of five tongues; glaze band with traces of added red and white bands.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.675)
